title: YARD / PILE OF ETERNITE
description: Someone has left some crumbly looking eternite panels leaning against this wall. Most suspicious.

dialogueTree.title: Pile of Eternite: "An inconspicuous pile of the roofin..."
dialogueTree.text: An inconspicuous pile of the roofing material, eternite.

links.title: Pile of Eternite: "It's nothing. Someone just left som..."
links.text: It's nothing. Someone just left some roofing material slanted against an old shack.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Glad you asked. When junior researc..."
links.text: Glad you asked. When junior researcher Õlari Taal invented eternite in the Värtna Polytechnic Institute, some thirty odd years ago, he thought it would last forever -- hence the name eternite. Sadly the only lasting thing turned out to be the material's highly carcinogenic effect.

links.title: You: "Why am I looking at this pile of th..."
links.text: Why am I looking at this pile of the roofing material?

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Because there's a secret door hidde..."
links.text: Because there's a secret door hidden behind the panels of eternite. That's why they're *too* orderly.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "There it is! You see a shabby littl..."
links.text: There it is! You see a shabby little door.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What is this, then? A tool shed?"..."
links.text: "What is this, then? A tool shed?" He peeks inside. "Let's investigate."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "Because it's nice and orderly. Well..."
links.text: Because it's nice and orderly. Well laid pallet. Easy on the eyes.

links.title: Perception (Sight): "It reveals no secrets at this time."
links.text: It reveals no secrets at this time.

links.title: Conceptualization: "Rhythmic pattern -- calms your mind..."
links.text: Rhythmic pattern -- calms your mind. Mammals like this stuff.

links.title: Inland Empire: "No, there's more to this. You get t..."
links.text: No, there's more to this. You get this strange *feeling*.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Hard to say, it's gone now. Feeling..."
links.text: Hard to say, it's gone now. Feelings pass, you see. Especially the small ones.
